p: M protein is the other main structural proteins of SAR‐CoV‐2 determining the shape of the virus envelope. This protein also confirms the nucleocapsid stability, promotes viral assembly and encapsulates the viral genome. Qin et al. designed siRNAs that degrade M mRNA and block the expression of M protein in SARS‐associated coronavirus, proposing an approach for researches towards developing the new therapeutic agents for CoV infection (Qin, Zhao, Cao, & Qi, 2007).
